metadata.dcterms:title: Elevated Fecal Calprotectin in the Second or Third Trimester of Pregnancy Predicts Preterm Delivery in Women with IBD
metadata.dcterms:creator: Huang, Vivian
Elahi, Shokrollah
Madsen, Karen
Fedorak, Richard
Dieleman, Levinus
Wine, Eytan
Lumb, Rowan
metadata.dcterms:description: The objective of this study was to evaluate whether a FCP measurement in the 2nd or 3rd trimester of pregnancy in women with IBD can predict preterm delivery.
metadata.dcterms:subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
Crohn's disease
pregnancy
ulcerative colitis
cohort studies
infant
biomarkers
C-reactive protein
inflammatory bowel diseases
faecal calprotectin
